Announced on February 12, 2021, The Luxembourg Minister of Education, Children and Youth allowed primary and secondary schools to open but under very strict conditions. For primary schools, It includes mandatory masks from students in the second cycle, there will be more testing, with everyone who was in quarantine requiring a test to return to school (antigen test). For secondary schools the pupils will return to alternate between two groups A/B schooling, exam schedules and study material for final years will be reduced of 15% and deadlines for final test will be adjusted.
 UPDATE: Originally pupils of primary and secondary school have been alternating between face-to-face and/or distance learning courses. From May 31, 2021, the Ministry of National Education, Children and Youth of Luxembourg announces that classes from the secondary school will once again operate in whole classes face-to-face.
